entry.title: Apriori Algorithm
entry.content:
Introduction

  • Apriori algorithm is one of the association rules. It was proposed by Agrawal and R. Srikant in 1994. And it was designed to operate on databases that contain transations(for example, collections of items bought by customers, or details of a website frequentation ).
  • Apriori is an algorithm for frequent item set mining and association rule learning over transactionsal databases. It proceeds by identifying the frequent individual items in the database and extending them to larger and larger item sets as long as those item sets appear sufficiently often in the database. The frequent item sets determined by Apriori can be used to determine association rules which highlight gerneral trends in the database: this has applications in domains such as market basket analysis.

Mathematical Definition

$$X \to Y, X \subset L, Y \subset L, X \cap Y = \phi$$

Hwo

Example

References

  • 第10章關聯法則.ppt
  • Fast Algorithms for Mining Association Rules 1994
  • Apriori algorithm Wiki

entry.title: Lecture 01 Introduction 2(Algorithm)
entry.content:
What is an algorithm?

  • An algorithm is a sequence of unambiguous instructions for solving a problem, i.e. for obtaining a required output for any legitimate input in a finite amount of time.

entry.title: Lecture 01 Introduction(Algorithm)
entry.content:
General infomation

  • Course Unit: 3
  • Course Type: Compulsory for all majors
  • Instructor: Dr. Hon-Cheng Wong(黃漢青)

Objectives

  • MIIZ43 is designed to provide an introduction to the analysis and design of algorithms for graduate students.
  • The course will cover the analysis of algorithm efficiency, the force and exhaustive search, decrease-and-conquer, divide-and-conquer, transform-and-conquer, space and time trade-offs, dynamic programming, greedy technique, iterative improvement, and limitations of algorithm power.

Grading scheme

  • Written assignments: 20%
  • Midterm: 30%(Closed book)
  • Final exam: 50%(Closed book)

Text and references

  • Textbook: Levitin. Introduction to the Design and Analysis of Algorithms, Thrid Edition, Pearson, 2012
  • References

Course material

  • You may get the course material from folder “MIIZ43” on ftp://ftp.must.edu.mo/
